newsitem.title: GHANA: CONSUMER INFLATION FALLS FOR 15TH CONSECUTIVE MONTH.
newsitem.headline: CONSUMER INFLATION FALLS FOR 15TH CONSECUTIVE MONTH.

text.p: service issued the following consumer price inflation data --

Note - Consumer inflation in Ghana has now fallen for the 15th consecutive month, reflecting the central bank's policy of maintaining high interest rates -- 47.93 percent in March for 91-day T-bills -- to mop up excess liquidity.
Prices over the month of March showed an increase of 2.8 percent, a slight improvement on February's three percent.
Food, which accounts for 49.2 percent of the National Index, recorded an increase of 2.9 percent compared with February.
The government's objective is to reduce year-on-year inflation to 15 percent by December 31, 1997.
